snippet: Uganda has been accused of buying junk helicopters at inflated prices, and the deaths of as many as seven air force personnel in three crashes on Sunday are raising new questions.
abstract: Uganda has been accused of buying poorly reconditioned, secondhand military helicopters at inflated prices, and the deaths of as many as seven air force personnel in three crashes are raising new questions.

byline.original: By JEFFREY GETTLEMAN and JOSH KRON
byline.contributor: Jeffrey Gettleman reported from Nairobi, and Josh Kron from Kampala, Uganda. Reuben Kyama contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Uganda has been accused of buying junk helicopters at inflated prices, and the deaths of as many as seven air force personnel in three crashes on Sunday are raising new questions.

headline.seo: Crashes Underline Uganda’s Spotty Record With Helicopters
headline.main: Crashes Underline Uganda’s Spotty Record With Helicopters
headline.print_headline: Crashes Underline Uganda’s Spotty Record With Helicopters
